title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 474.4 - Retention of forms by seller
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 474.4 - Retention of forms by seller

State Regulations
(a) Forms executed pursuant to section
474.3
of this Part shall be retained by the seller and maintained on the premises of
sale for a period of five years. The forms shall be available at all reasonable
hours for inspection by any peace or police officer acting pursuant to his or
her special duties. Executed forms may be destroyed after five years. (b) Forms shall be forwarded to the

Superintendent of State Police only when: (1)
the seller having possession of the forms ceases to be a licensed dealer in
firearms or licensed pharmacists; or
(2)
said person permanently ceases to be
engaged actively in the selling of firearms or as a pharmacist. In such cases, and only in such cases, retained forms shall
be sent within 30 days to: Superintendent of State Police

Records Unit
1220 Washington Avenue

Building 22

Albany, NY 12226-2252

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
474.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
